verse.roman:
evaṁ sammantrya dāśārhau
daṁśitau rathinau purāt
nirjagmatuḥ svāyudhāḍhyau
balenālpīyasā vṛtau

synonyms: evam—thus; sammantrya—inviting Him; dāśārhau—the two descendants of Daśārha (Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma); daṁśitau—wearing armor; rathinau—riding Their chariots; purāt—from the city; nirjagmatuḥ—went out; sva—Their own; āyudha—with weapons; āḍhyau—resplendent; balena—by a force; alpīyasā—very small; vṛtau—accompanied.
translation: After Lord Kṛṣṇa had thus invited His brother, the two Dāśārhas, Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma, wearing armor and displaying Their resplendent weapons, drove out of the city in Their chariots. Only a very small contingent of soldiers accompanied Them.
